GENERAL.FURTHERINFORMATION: A ~o~household disturbance~w~ has been reported, details unknown. Attend the scene and ~y~ascertain the situation~w~.
GENERAL.NOTIFICATION: Resolve the situation. You may want to ~y~search for witnesses~w~ if there are any.

OUTCOME.DIALOGUES: ~b~You:~w~ Hey, what’s going on here? ~y~Male:~w~ She just won’t let it go! Every little thing sets her off. I’m sick and tired of it! // ped 1 ~y~Female:~w~ He just won’t let it go! Every little thing sets him off. I’m sick and tired of it! // ped 1 ~b~You:~w~ Let's hear her side of the story. ~b~You:~w~ Let's hear his side of the story. ~y~Male:~w~ I’m just asking for some respect! He brushes me off like I’m not even here, and it drives me crazy. // ped 2 ~y~Male:~w~ I’m not ignoring you! I just don’t think everything’s a crisis, but you act like it is. // ped 1 ~b~You:~w~ It sounds like you're not hearing each other. Why does this keep happening? ~y~Male:~w~ She always jumps to conclusions before we can even talk it through. I just need some space! // ped 1 ~y~Female:~w~ He always jumps to conclusions before we can even talk it through. I just need some space! // ped 1 ~y~Male:~w~ I don’t want to fight! I just want her to understand, and she shuts me down before I even get a chance to explain. // ped 2 ~y~Female:~w~ I don’t want to fight! I just want him to understand, and he shuts me down before I even get a chance to explain. // ped 2 ~b~You:~w~ Okay, let’s all take a step back. The important thing is that everyone communicates and is heard. ~y~Male:~w~ I get it. It's just frustrating that it feels like I’m talking to a brick wall most of the time. // ped 2 ~y~Female:~w~ I get it. It's just frustrating that it feels like I’m talking to a brick wall most of the time. // ped 2 ~y~Male:~w~ I hear you, just not in the right way. // ped 1 ~y~Female:~w~ I hear you, just not in the right way. // ped 1 ~b~You:~w~ Can I trust you guys to resolve this sensibly? ~y~Male:~w~ Yes Officer, sorry...heat of the moment. // ped 2 ~y~Female:~w~ Yes Officer, sorry...heat of the moment. // ped 2

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hey! What’s going on here?!
~y~Male:~w~ I’M DONE WITH HER, OFFICER! She NEVER stops running her mouth!
~y~Female:~w~ I’M DONE WITH HIM, OFFICER! He NEVER stops running his mouth!
~y~Male:~w~ OH PLEASE! You’re the one who storms around like a damn child whenever things don’t go your way!
~y~Female:~w~ OH PLEASE! You’re the one who storms around like a damn child whenever things don’t go your way!
~b~You:~w~ Both of you, take a breath! We’re not doing this right now.
~y~Male:~w~ She doesn’t LISTEN! She just keeps PUSHING and PUSHING!
~y~Female:~w~ He doesn’t LISTEN! He just keeps PUSHING and PUSHING!
~y~Male:~w~ BECAUSE YOU NEVER TAKE ANYTHING SERIOUSLY! YOU LAUGH IN MY FACE LIKE I’M NOTHING!
~y~Female:~w~ BECAUSE YOU NEVER TAKE ANYTHING SERIOUSLY! YOU LAUGH IN MY FACE LIKE I’M NOTHING!
~b~You:~w~ ENOUGH! Step back, NOW!
~y~Male:~w~ You want me to step back?! MAYBE SHE SHOULD SHUT UP FOR ONCE!
~y~Female:~w~ You want me to step back?! MAYBE HE SHOULD SHUT UP FOR ONCE!
~y~Male:~w~ YOU WANNA GO?! SAY THAT AGAIN TO MY FACE!
~y~Female:~w~ YOU WANNA GO?! SAY THAT AGAIN TO MY FACE!
~y~Male:~w~ Oh you're gonna get a punch to the face now!
~y~Female:~w~ Oh you're gonna get a punch to the face now!
~y~Male:~w~ Officer, she's attacking me! HELP!
~y~Female:~w~ Officer, he's attacking me! HELP!
~y~Male:~w~ You think you can do whatever you want? You deserve this!
~y~Female:~w~ You think you can do whatever you want? You deserve this!
~y~Male:~w~ Your punches suck! Let me show you how to land a REAL blow!
~y~Female:~w~ Your punches suck! Let me show you how to land a REAL blow!

OUTCOME.DIALOGUES: ~b~You:~w~ Alright, what’s going on here? ~y~Male:~w~ Officer, THANK GOD you’re here! She HIT me! ~y~Female:~w~ Officer, THANK GOD you’re here! He HIT me! ~y~Male:~w~ THAT’S A LIE! I didn’t lay a hand on her! ~y~Female:~w~ THAT’S A LIE! I didn’t lay a hand on him! ~b~You:~w~ Everyone take a breath. M'am, tell me exactly what happened. // we are referring to the other ped of the opposite gender. ~b~You:~w~ Everyone take a breath. Sir, tell me exactly what happened. // we are referring to the other ped of the opposite gender. ~y~Male:~w~ We were arguing, and then she LOST IT! She grabbed me and shoved me! ~y~Female:~w~ We were arguing, and then he LOST IT! He grabbed me and shoved me! ~y~Male:~w~ I DIDN’T TOUCH YOU! You’re making this up because you’re pissed off! ~y~Female:~w~ I DIDN’T TOUCH YOU! You’re making this up because you’re pissed off! ~b~You:~w~ Sir, keep your voice down. Did you put your hands on her or not? ~b~You:~w~ M'am, keep your voice down. Did you put your hands on him or not? ~y~Male:~w~ NO! I swear, I didn’t! She’s the one who threw something at ME! ~y~Female:~w~ NO! I swear, I didn’t! He’s the one who threw something at ME! ~y~Male:~w~ That’s because you wouldn’t STOP screaming in my face! I was SCARED! ~y~Female:~w~ That’s because you wouldn’t STOP screaming in my face! I was SCARED! ~b~You:~w~ Alright, enough! I need both of you to stay where you are. We’re going to get to the bottom of this.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hey there. We're investigating a disturbance nearby. Have you noticed anything unusual?
~y~Bystander:~w~ Well why do you ask? Is it about that couple down the street?
~b~You:~w~ I can't get into specifics, I just wanted to know if you've noticed anything out of the ordinary.
~y~Bystander:~w~ I don't want to get involved. But let me just say this. A word to the wise, her husband is an awful man.
~b~You:~w~ Okay, did you see anything in particular?
~y~Bystander:~w~ Word is on the street that their marriage got messy. I don't know anymore.
~b~You:~w~ Thank you for the information.
~b~You:~w~ Hey there. We're investigating a disturbance nearby. Have you noticed anything unusual?
~y~Bystander:~w~ The only thing unusual is how smoking hot you are Officer.
~b~You:~w~ Thanks, I guess. But I am only interested in any information about a disturbance would could help our investigation.
~y~Bystander:~w~ Then I'm no help, feel free to hit me up when you're off duty though.
~b~You:~w~ Great, thanks.

OUTCOME.DIALOGUES: ~b~You:~w~ Alright, what’s going on here? ~y~Male:~w~ Officer my roommate is out of control. They totally flipped out on me! ~y~Female:~w~ Officer my roommate is out of control. That's absurd! ~y~Female:~w~ Those are my valuable items! You can't just throw them out! I want to press charges for theft! ~y~Female:~w~ The bins were collected so all my stuff is gone! GONE! I want to press charges for theft! ~y~Male:~w~ Oh come on. That's ridiculous, you know that Officer. ~y~Female:~w~ Oh come on. That's ridiculous, you know that Officer. ~b~You:~w~ Both of you need to behave yourself, I will get to the bottom of this.

~b~You:~w~ Hi there. I am investigating events that happened in a nearby property. Have you seen anything strange recently? ~y~Bystander:~w~ No I haven't officer, but those two roommates are always up at each others neck. ~b~You:~w~ It has been alleged that someone has thrown away the others stuff in the trash. Did you see anything like this? ~y~Bystander:~w~ I did actually. One of them, I don't remember which, was carrying lots of bags full of rubbish. // the gender of the suspect is unknown, for it could be the man or woman. The bystander does not remember. ~b~You:~w~ That's very helpful. Is this the first time you've seen them do that? ~y~Bystander:~w~ Throwing lots of rubbish? Yes. But I've had to tell them in the past to keep the volume down, they argue quite a bit. ~b~You:~w~ Thanks for the valuable assistance. Take care.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hi there. I am investigating events that happened in a nearby property. Have you seen anything strange recently?
~y~Bystander:~w~ Sorry officer, I haven't seen anything strange.
~b~You:~w~ It has been alleged that someone has thrown away the others stuff in the trash. Did you see anything like this?
~y~Bystander:~w~I didn't see anything of the sorts. I have just come back from a holiday abroad.
~b~You:~w~ I understand. Do you know much about the roommates living nearby?
~y~Bystander:~w~ No, I try to stay clear of them if I am honest. They're a bit strange.
~b~You:~w~ Thanks for the information.

Here’s what’s going to happen—we’re going to handle this the right way. So let’s keep this civil.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hello there. We're investigating a disturbance nearby. Do you have any possible information?
~y~Bystander:~w~ No, sorry. It's not my business.
~b~You:~w~ I understand, thank you.
~b~You:~w~ Hello there. We're investigating a disturbance nearby. Do you have any possible information?
~y~Bystander:~w~ Why, what's going on?
~b~You:~w~ An argument has broken out a few houses down, did you know anything about the couple who lived there?
~y~Bystander:~w~That's a bit of an intrusive question, no. I don't know anything about that.
~b~You:~w~ Okay, thank you.

~y~Female:~w~ FINE! LET'S FINISH THIS!

OUTCOME.NOTIFICATION: Maintain a ~g~safe distance~w~ of at least ~g~15 metres~w~ while the hostage conversation carries out. ~y~Prepare for any outcome~w~.
